answers.answer: Unfortunately there is not much we can do for you over the internet, sorry.Keep trying to convince your GP to send you for the MRI.In my opinion, I don't think you are dealing with any cancer.
What other medical conditions do you have?  Diabetic?  Anxiety?
yes i have diabetes type 2 , no anxiety
Is your Diabetes under control;are your blood sugar in a good range now?What medications are you taking now?

thank you for your reply , my diabetes is under control i am on 2000mg of metformin a day , i was only diagnosed on xmas eve , but the doctor thinks i have had it a while before i was diagnosed , the other problems i have back ache head ache etc came about 5 to 6 weeks before i was told i had diabetes, so i dont know if it has anything to do with this , like i say my doctor is no help what so ever
Can you not find another physician willing to work with you or not?

HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!I suggest you change your GP if possible and get MRI of lower spine and nerve conduction studies done. Either it is peripheral neuropathy or a pinched nerve. Other than this it can also be deep vein thrombosis, which can be diagnosed by duplex ultrasounds. Take care!

the first thing that comes to mind is that the nausea can be a symptom from the headache. Migraines can make you very sensitive to light, sound, smell and taste. A headache that does not go away for 3 weeks, that is a long time. I must ask is where is the the pain. If it is more in the front and your forehead is swollen I would think more towards sinus issues. Even allergies. Try some OTC meds for sinus pressure or allergies. If this is your issue you should feel better rather fast. If it is not I would go to your closest ER as they will run more tests and give you a better answer.

question: hi, i have a list of symptoms and no doctor seems to be helping me. my symptoms started 3 months ago with severe pain in my lower middle back and pain in both of my legs mainly calfs and ankles , in the last 8 weeks the pain has gone halfway up my back and around my left rib , i have had a headache for about 3 weeks , sometimes really severe , but it never goes, it is always there , i also have an achy left arm , i spoke to my dr he says sciatica which i know is wrong , he didnt even look at me , i am ok if i am sat but i cannot walk further than 20 mtrs , if i do my calfs and lower back really hurt and i suffer with the worst headache ever , even feeling nauseating with it and i have to lay down for the rest of the day , can someone please help , i live in england and everyone mri etc i need to see i have to go through my general practitioner , and hes just not refering me to anybody.
title: please help..is it cancer
